newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Ceylon Brewery sharply up on results.
newsitem.headline: Ceylon Brewery sharply up on results.

text.p: Sri Lanka's main brewer, Ceylon Brewery Ltd, rose 2.25 rupees, or 6.8 percent, to 35.50 on Monday because of sharply higher profits, brokers said.
"The scrip is up since six-month profits to September are 32.66 million rupees, from 5.59 million in the same period in 1995," a local broker said.
Turnover of the counter in the morning session on Monday was 8,400 shares.
The company benefitted from a drastic cut in excise duties on beer in the 1996 budget.
Ceylon Brewery also brews Carlsberg and Guinness under license.
